bibl.title: Two petitions concerning civic magistracies by a gymnasiarch and son of a veteran
bibl.seg: Amin Benaissa, Two Petitions Concerning Civic Magistracies by a Gymnasiarch and Son of a Veteran.

1. P.CtYBR [P. Yale] Inv. 505 (A = recto): draft of a petition to the prefect, concerning appointments to municipal magistracies. Oxyrhynchus, after 161 CE. - 2. Inv. 505 (B = verso): copy of petition to the prefect concerning the financing of spectacles by magistracies for a local festival, followed by the official response. Oxyrhynchus, after 1 April 169 or 201 CE. - Appendix: An imperial addressee? - Both petitions were by the same individual, Q. Marinus Claudianus, who was a gymnasiarch of Oxyrhynchus and the son of a veteran.
